data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Tentacle Grip
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Tentacruel. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon attacks its prey with its eighty toxin-producing tentacles.

abilities.name: Flee
abilities.text: If an attack does damage to Misty's Tentacruel while it's your Active Pokémon, you may switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, which prevents all other effects of that attack on Misty's Tentacruel. This power can't be used if Misty's Tentacruel is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Strange Tentacles
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), as long as the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon is less than the number of Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, you may choose an Energy card, if any, in your opponent's discard pile and attach it to the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tentacruel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Seething Tentacles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

abilities.name: Reactive Shield
abilities.text: As long as Tentacruel has any React Energy cards attached to it, prevent all effects, including damage, done to any of your Tentacruel in play by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Tentavolve
attacks.text: If Tentacruel evolved from Tentacool during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Wicked Tentacles
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on the Pokémon you moved the Energy to.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.

attacks.name: Long Tentacle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Void Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Paranormal
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Ultra Beasts.

data.flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.

abilities.name: Strange Tentacles
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), as long as the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon is less than the number of Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, you may choose an Energy card, if any, in your opponent's discard pile and attach it to the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tentacruel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Dancing Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, the are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Tentacle Strike
attacks.text: Search your opponent's discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to any of your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. For each Energy card attached in this way, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dangerous Poison
attacks.text: If Tentacruel has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Poisonous Prison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: It communicates with others of its kind by lighting up the red orbs on its head. When the orbs are blinking, it's a warning sign.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Poisonous Whip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tentacular Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. If the first flip is tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
